alert.note: Alert for Northern Wayne; Pike; Southern Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 12:18PM EST until March 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Southern Wayne, Pike and Northern Wayne counties. In New York, Sullivan, Otsego and Delaware counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow band that brought 1-2 inch per hour rates this morning has moved off to the east into the Catskills and will be out of the region by 2 pm. Pockets of heavier snow showers continue into the early evening as lake effect snow showers develop and move through CNY into NEPA.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorist to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
